            By 
Elena Schneider

10/04/15 10:53 AM EDT
Donald Trump made clear on Sunday he'd drop out of the race for the Republican presidential nomination if he plummets in the polls. 
“If [polls] changed, and that went in a different direction and if I thought that I wasn't going to win, like there are numerous people running, they’re not going to win, okay? I would certainly want to get out,” Trump said on ABC’s “This Week.” 
Story Continued Below
“I'm not a masochist," he said." I'm not somebody that needs to do this for other reasons.
But that’s not happening any time soon, he emphasized, as he continues to lead in Iowa and New Hampshire, according to a new NBC/Wall Street Journal/Marist poll released Sunday.
“Right now, I'm loving it,” he said. “I’m having a lot of fun.”



            By 
Daniel Strauss

Trump also shared his take on the airstrikes Russia launched in Syria last week, saying he wants to “sit back” and “see what happens.” He also said he would not accept Syrian refugees, if he were president. 
“I said there is no way they come in. If they do come in, if I win for president, they're going out,” Trump said. “You have Bahrain, you have Qatar, you have some of the richest countries, they're not taking any, and they're right there, so we're supposed to take 200,000 people that we have no idea who they are?”
“We are not going to take responsibility," he declared. "Are they ISIS? Probably not, but nobody knows.”
Trump did not call for a no-fly zone over Syria, either. Instead, he predicted Russia would get "bogged down" in Syria the way it did in Afghanistan in the 1980s when "it destroyed the Soviet Union."
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
title: Trump on his White House bid: 'I'm not a masochist'
